definition: to read out loud/(computing) to read (data)/readout (of a scientific instrument)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Using low pass filters before the readout device may also reduce bandwidth.
sentences.chinese: 在读出设备之前采用低通滤波器也可以减小带宽。

sentences.english: From his parents’ face express we can read surprise and anger.
sentences.chinese: 从他父母的表情中我们读出了惊愕和愤怒。

sentences.english: And he would name all the letters from A to Z. All 26 of them.
sentences.chinese: 他可以读出从A到Z的所有字母。

sentences.english: Try reading out loud the following famous poem by A. E. Housman.
sentences.chinese: 试著把下面这首霍斯曼所写的著名诗作大声读出来。

sentences.english: Everyone's trying to read deep significance into this.
sentences.chinese: 人人都在努力“读出”其中深义。

sentences.english: Read access to these registers is through the scratchpad.
sentences.chinese: 对这些的读出存取登记是通过便笺簿。
从那里我读出了它的经历。

sentences.english: "Readout" mode for NAND memory chips which have a huge count of bit errors.
sentences.chinese: 新的读出模式为了闪存芯片位错误有大的计算。

sentences.english: Seriously, a good pitch, hold your breath read out.
sentences.chinese: 认真地发好每一个音调，屏住呼吸读出。

sentences.english: She can even look at a line of characters and meanwhile read out their stroke numbers, just like reading a text.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至能像读课文一样流利读出一排文字的笔画数。

sentences.english: When you learn a new word, you should check the stress.
sentences.chinese: 在学一个新单词的时候，最好要大声把它读出来。

sentences.english: Read the figure shown on the barometer, please.
sentences.chinese: 请你读出气压表显示的数字。

sentences.english: She looked across the wangs eyes, also read the glad and rejoice in it.
sentences.chinese: 她望向对面王星的双眼，也在其中读出了庆幸与欢喜。

sentences.english: What does this cover say to you?
sentences.chinese: 你们从封面中读出了什么？

sentences.english: But they have to read the  panel in a mirror.
sentences.chinese: 他们要读出镜框内的视力表。

sentences.english: The Six Sigma Black Belt should be able to read values from a cumulative frequency ogive.
sentences.chinese: 六西格玛黑带应该能够从累计频次分布中读出数值。

definition: between the words and the lines (idiom); implied meaning/connotations
to contain in a concealed form/to keep covered up/implicit
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
to understand what one is reading or watching
